text: Austro-Hungarian map from 1887 depicting Lake Malik on the bottom right side, south of lake Ohrid. Lake Malik (Albanian: Liqeni I Maliqit, Macedonian: Маличко Езеро Malicko Ezero - meaning "small lake", Greek: Λίμνη Μαλίκη Límni Malíki) is an artificially drained lake in Albania. The government took the decision to drain the lake after 1939 to combat malaria. The draining operation started in 1946 using convict labour and it created new agricultural areas. ==References== Malik
title: Lake Malik
